paper_abstract: In this paper we deal with the following problem: Given a set B consisting of n points, not all on a line or a circle. A circle passes through exactly three points of B is called an ordinary circle. What is the minimal possible number of ordinary circles determined by B? In this paper we improve the best-known lower bound 22/247 (n 2) to 1/9 (n 2).
paper_title: On the Number of Ordinary Circles Determined by n Points
